snippet: Federal prosecutors who have spent nearly two years investigating the death of a teenager found in a rolled-up gym mat at Lowndes High School are asking a judge for a six-month halt to evidence gathering in a lawsuit by the boy’s parents.
abstract: Federal Prosecutors request judge in wrongful-death lawsuit brought by parents of Kendrick Johnson order all evidence gathering for the case to stop for next six months; reason for requested break in case involving Valdosta, Ga, death of Johnson, who was found in rolled-up gym mat at school, is unclear.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors who have spent nearly two years investigating the death of a teenager found in a rolled-up gym mat at Lowndes High School are asking a judge for a six-month halt to evidence gathering in a lawsuit by the boy’s parents.

headline.print_headline: Georgia: Halt Sought to Gathering of Evidence in Wrongful-Death Suit
headline.main: Georgia: Halt Sought to Gathering of Evidence in Wrongful-Death Suit
